commit_message:
Add RootStackName parameter on stack update

The task to add the RootStackName parameter to plan-environment.yaml in
the plan was only in the create_deployment_plan workflow. This patch
also adds it to the update_deployment_plan workflow so that the
parameter will be present in the environment for both stack create and
update.

Change-Id: I560eaff21c22d2ab70c657b35a3d43a76003e6ba
Closes-Bug: #1853362
(cherry picked from commit 07444eed0736ceab8af6ca7b37877223cfc4ade7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/36/707436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - The RootStackName parameter is now added to the plan in plan-environment.yaml on both stack create and update. Previously it was only added on create.

subject: Replace '' by [] when a bind mount isn't needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-10 17:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-metadata-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/cinder/cinder-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/zaqar/zaqar-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/ironic/ironic-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/heat/heat-api-cfn-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/keystone/keystone-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/placement/placement-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/heat/heat-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/manila/manila-api-container-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/aodh/aodh-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d58c133d371b71aed9a0e7b18c73871f2fdbcee4', 'message': 'Replace '' by [] when a bind mount isn't needed

To avoid empty volumes like:

{
  (...)
  "volumes": [
    "/etc/puppet:/etc/puppet:ro",
    (...)
    "",
    ""
  ],
}

Replace '' by [], so heat won't create an item in the list.
It helps to have idempotent containers, since podman_container module
will compare the list of volumes that is given in parameters (containing
the empty entries) vs the list of volumes actually in podman inspect.
Replacing to [] clears out empty volumes and makes these containers
idempotent when podman_container module is used to deploy containers.

Change-Id: I228b01009e7d9980bee5480778dbc88b9e226297
(cherry picked from commit 98118b6294b750e3b344ff7fc74492ac229bd866)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace '' by [] when a bind mount isn't needed

To avoid empty volumes like:

{
  (...)
  "volumes": [
    "/etc/puppet:/etc/puppet:ro",
    (...)
    "",
    ""
  ],
}

Replace '' by [], so heat won't create an item in the list.
It helps to have idempotent containers, since podman_container module
will compare the list of volumes that is given in parameters (containing
the empty entries) vs the list of volumes actually in podman inspect.
Replacing to [] clears out empty volumes and makes these containers
idempotent when podman_container module is used to deploy containers.

Change-Id: I228b01009e7d9980bee5480778dbc88b9e226297
(cherry picked from commit 98118b6294b750e3b344ff7fc74492ac229bd866)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary slash volume maps

When podman parses such volume map it removes the slash
automatically and shows in inspection volumes w/o slash.
When comparing configurations it turns to be a difference and
it breaks idempotency of containers, causing them to be recreated.

Change-Id: Ifdebecc8c7975b6f5cfefb14b0133be247b7abf0
(cherry picked from commit 016f7c600242e1a1c7930eb41b762aed3a98701f)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

coverage2sql is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I7e523bff1144d827dd1377c00d4a51512e265a85

subject: Fix generation of TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH for services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-22 16:15:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/132d3012e4d6cf9ecd3e6ef1484b690a3aca6e7f', 'message': 'Fix generation of TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH for services

A container gets a config hash if one of its bind mount references
/var/lib/config-data/(puppet-generated)?/service. That hash is
created/managed by container-puppet.py and stored in
/var/lib/config-data/(puppet-generated)?/service.md5sum

Currently, the parsing of bind-mount is broken so container-puppet.py
never associates or regenerates config hashes for containers. Fix
the parsing to make sure that any bind-mounts starting with
/var/lib/config-data always resolve to the right md5sum file.

commit_message:
Fix generation of TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH for services

A container gets a config hash if one of its bind mount references
/var/lib/config-data/(puppet-generated)?/service. That hash is
created/managed by container-puppet.py and stored in
/var/lib/config-data/(puppet-generated)?/service.md5sum

Currently, the parsing of bind-mount is broken so container-puppet.py
never associates or regenerates config hashes for containers. Fix
the parsing to make sure that any bind-mounts starting with
/var/lib/config-data always resolve to the right md5sum file.

Change-Id: I7ad50d62e6177f109f513c4c11f611be60e570f2
Closes-Bug: #1860364
(cherry picked from commit a5ffef4a40dbfb48926dfd6b0057547343b9a082)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/31/703831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_config_base(prefix, volume): # crawl the volume's path upwards until we find the # volume's base, where the hashed config file resides path = volume base = prefix.rstrip(os.path.sep) base_generated = os.path.join(base, 'puppet-generated') while path.startswith(prefix): dirname = os.path.dirname(path) if dirname == base or dirname == base_generated: return path else: path = dirname raise ValueError("Could not find config's base for '%s'" % volume) return sorted([get_config_base(prefix, v.split(":")[0]) for v in volumes if v.startswith(prefix)])
deleted_lines: return sorted([os.path.dirname(v.split(":")[0]) for v in volumes if v.startswith(prefix)])

subject: Do not inherit cinder_ image properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-06 15:07:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py', 'releasenotes/notes/cinder-no-inherit-image-props-219c548a1c4870e6.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6145c505de0dae9d366d38b250957a8d9d6eb352', 'message': 'Do not inherit cinder_ image properties

In the unlikely event that an end user creates an image from an
active yet unusable instance that was booted from a glance image
of an encrypted cinder volume, deleting such an image will result
in deletion of the encryption key for the original image, thereby
leading to data loss.  This can be prevented by blocking inheritance
of the two cinder_encryption_key_* properties.

Change-Id: If20071d8e7ce6c0a4efd14a7fa6d9adef3c9fba6
Partial-bug: #1852106
'}]
commit_message:
Do not inherit cinder_ image properties

In the unlikely event that an end user creates an image from an
active yet unusable instance that was booted from a glance image
of an encrypted cinder volume, deleting such an image will result
in deletion of the encryption key for the original image, thereby
leading to data loss.  This can be prevented by blocking inheritance
of the two cinder_encryption_key_* properties.

Change-Id: If20071d8e7ce6c0a4efd14a7fa6d9adef3c9fba6
Partial-bug: #1852106
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/706298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- issues: - | Nova does not support direct booting of an instance from an image that was created from an encrypted volume using the Block Storage Service. If you do boot from such an image, the instance goes ACTIVE but is unusable. If a user performs the image-create action on such an instance, and the new image inherits the ``cinder_encryption_key_id`` and ``cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy`` image properties (which happens in the default configuration), when the new image is deleted, the encryption key for the *original* image will be deleted, thereby rendering it unusable for the normal workflow of creating a volume from the image and booting an instance from the volume. The fix for this issue is to include both ``cinder_encryption_key_id`` and ``cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy`` in the ``non_inheritable_image_properties`` list in ``nova.conf``. upgrade: - | The image properties ``cinder_encryption_key_id`` and ``cinder_encryption_key_deletion_policy`` are now included by default in the ``non_inheritable_image_properties`` configuration option. If you have a custom setting for this property in your ``nova.conf`` file, you should include these properties as well. See the "Known Issues" section of this document for details.

So instead of hardcoding 'python' as executable, use the executable that is used to run the tests itself which is sys.executable . '/proc/34/cmdline', 'python 1234')).mock_open - p = daemon.Pidfile('thefile', 'python', uuid='1234') + '/proc/34/cmdline', '{} 1234'.format( + sys.executable))).mock_open + p = daemon.Pidfile('thefile', sys.executable, uuid='1234') with mock.patch.object(p, 'read') as read: read.return_value = 34 @@ -218,8 +220,9 @@ class TestPidfile(base.BaseTestCase): def test_is_running_uuid_false(self): mock_open = self.useFixture( lib_fixtures.OpenFixture( - self.assertEqual(d.procname, 'python') + self.assertEqual(d.procname, sys.executable) def test_init_nopidfile(self): d = daemon.Daemon(pidfile=None) - self.assertEqual(d.procname, 'python') + self.assertEqual(d.procname, sys.executable) self.assertFalse(self.pidfile.called) def test_fork_parent(self): -- 2.21.1

commit_message:
Fix Octavia certificate file path and content

Certificate files were being created in a wrong path and with invalid
content. The bug was caused because Ansible variables were not being
quoted, and as so Ansible assumed plain text instead.

Closes-Bug: #1830190

Change-Id: Ie576537d77b57927d430f20b274d1cb5d351241e
(cherry picked from commit 4de9f78b291e2a1f0311aa4c705daba08322cc7e)
(cherry picked from commit 71c099f2092e77b35099eee1e1e763283549c7ad)

subject: Execute healthchecks as root
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-12 14:49:36.000000000', 'files': ['paunch/tests/test_utils_systemd.py', 'paunch/utils/systemd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/754c7885f4e86405c6206e339dbb12fc380368b9', 'message': 'Execute healthchecks as root

Some containers doesn't have the "default" user set to root (which is
good). This lead to healthcheck_port() function to return a message
because the non-root user isn't allowed to call "ss" command as itself.

Ensuring we're running the healthchecks as root will also allow to stop
duplicating some commands, making them faster and smaller for the
system.

This was discovered and discussed on Red Hat bugzilla first, then ported
to Launchpad.

Change-Id: I2e49d4dd5b385237f4f79929c70365424f6fa22d
Closes-Bug: 1860569
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778881
(cherry picked from commit 3012fe75aa1385896e45abf797e6adb2ee5c72ae)
(cherry picked from commit 592dab7a847140171e534bba395fcb1be42ce44e)
'}]
commit_message:
Execute healthchecks as root

Some containers doesn't have the "default" user set to root (which is
good). This lead to healthcheck_port() function to return a message
because the non-root user isn't allowed to call "ss" command as itself.

Ensuring we're running the healthchecks as root will also allow to stop
duplicating some commands, making them faster and smaller for the
system.

This was discovered and discussed on Red Hat bugzilla first, then ported
to Launchpad.

Change-Id: I2e49d4dd5b385237f4f79929c70365424f6fa22d
Closes-Bug: 1860569
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778881
(cherry picked from commit 3012fe75aa1385896e45abf797e6adb2ee5c72ae)
(cherry picked from commit 592dab7a847140171e534bba395fcb1be42ce44e)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-07 14:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['common/container-puppet.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/bbfb02b2d0929dccfed67014d3cc06a1ffaf2a1c', 'message': "Update ro excludes

commit_message:
Update ro excludes

When container-puppet.sh (or docker-puppet.sh) runs, we always bind
mount in certain directories and files. However if these files change
while we're running the puppet execution externally on the host, they
end up being copied to our puppet-generated path. This path is copied
into the container when kolla starts up. Because we re-mount these same
paths in the end container as read-only, kolla will try and update the
read-only mount which errors. This change updates our rsync excludes to
include:

 * /etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted
 * /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors
 * /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt
 * /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.trust.crt
 * /etc/pki/tls/cert.pem
 * /etc/hosts
 * /etc/localtime

Conflicts:
        common/container-puppet.sh

Change-Id: I858a7b8745688c6271b01795460ab4adbf3f2be5
Closes-Bug: #1860607
(cherry picked from commit 36ea0148e8b2ed30fb0a03fe6f812fd00657924b)

commit_message:
container_puppet_config: cleanup old config files

In I98963941c9d969ab1dfd92d70f973013f84e1c25, we removed
/var/lib/docker-puppet and
/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config-*.json.
Also, since the usage of container_puppet_config, there is no more
'hashed-' file when a container has a new config hash. The hash is
included in the same container config file.

The container_puppet_config module will take care of making sure no old
container startup config remains in /var/lib/tripleo-config as well as
hashed files; which aren't useful anymore and could cause troubles and
confusion.

This patch will have to be backported to stable/train.

Change-Id: I595a998196b6de386a4ff345c39fe1e6a9ed62c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/72/706972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Cleanup old configs generated in previous versions self._cleanup_old_configs() def _remove_file(self, path): """Remove a file. :param path: string """ if self._exists(path): os.remove(path) if config.startswith('hashed-'): # Take the opportunity to cleanup old hashed files which # don't exist anymore. self._remove_file(config) continue def _cleanup_old_configs(self): """Cleanup old container configurations and directories. """ # This configuration file was removed here: # https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702876 old_config = CONTAINER_STARTUP_CONFIG + '-step_' + self.step + '.json' self._remove_file(old_config)

commit_message:
Rely on u-c for venv installation

Good to rely on upper-constraints for tested versions and
to avoid upper bound in requirements.txt for projects.

Also remove not needed virtualenv_site_packages.

Also remove unnecessary relying on system ansible
to setup docker registry. Mixing system ansible
with the zuul one can create issue like Bug #1829736,
this patch handles registry setup like other zuul tasks.
Also rocky had old rpms(six-1.11.0) which are not compatible with
latest virtualenv(20.0.2)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707525/
Change-Id: Ib25c24078a8ee6bb6400e78999149ba186818c05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/30/707330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Install deps from upper-constraints pip: extra_args: "-c {{ openstack_git_root }}/requirements/upper-constraints.txt" requirements: "{{ openstack_git_root }}/{{ item }}/requirements.txt" virtualenv: "{{ workspace }}/venv_build" virtualenv_python: "{{ virtualenv_python[ansible_pkg_mgr] }}" virtualenv_site_packages: true with_items: - kolla - tripleo-common - python-tripleoclient

commit_message:
keystone: add a new parameter 'keystone_resources_managed'

keystone_resources_managed, default to
hiera('keystone_resources_managed', true) for backward compatibility,
will allow to disable Puppet to manage the keystone resources, like
endpoints, roles, services, projects and users; and instead use Ansible.

Change-Id: If4b275d3caf6098e7774d938ab89333396fbc15d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/67/697667/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*keystone_resources_managed*] # (Optional) Enable the management of Keystone resources with Puppet. # Can be disabled if Ansible manages these resources instead of Puppet. # The resources are: endpoints, roles, services, projects, users and their # assignment. # Defaults to hiera('keystone_resources_managed', true) # $keystone_resources_managed = hiera('keystone_resources_managed', true), ) { if $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) and $keystone_resources_managed {

commit_message:
Check return value of get subnets before iterate for ironic

With the update of openstack clients:
openstack client >= 4.0.0
neutron client >= 6.14.0
neturon lib >= 1.29.1

The command 'openstack network show ${network} -f value -c subnets'
returns '[]' instead of null string if no subnets found in the
specific network. This commit adds a check logic to avoid subsequent
command returns error by using '[]' as subnet input.

Change-Id: I7e7d5209227b0e34131b7715dbd3faa6066a94b7
Signed-off-by: Mingyuan Qi <mingyuan.qi@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/27/698427/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SUBNETS=$(openstack network show $IRONIC_NEUTRON_CLEANING_NET_ID -f value -c subnets) if [ "x${SUBNETS}" != "x[]" ]; then for SUBNET in ${SUBNETS}; do CURRENT_SUBNET=$(openstack subnet show $SUBNET -f value -c name) if [ "x${CURRENT_SUBNET}" == "x${neutron_subnet_name}" ]; then openstack subnet show ${neutron_subnet_name} SUBNET_EXISTS=true fi done fi
deleted_lines: for SUBNET in $(openstack network show $IRONIC_NEUTRON_CLEANING_NET_ID -f value -c subnets); do CURRENT_SUBNET=$(openstack subnet show $SUBNET -f value -c name) if [ "x${CURRENT_SUBNET}" == "x${neutron_subnet_name}" ]; then openstack subnet show ${neutron_subnet_name} SUBNET_EXISTS=true fi done

* Adding "convert_output_data" config property gives an opportunity
  to increase overal performance. If YAQL always converts an expression
  result, it often takes significant CPU time and overall workflow
  execution time increases. It is especially important when a workflow
  publishes lots of data into the context and uses big workflow
  environments. It's been tested on a very big workflow (~7k tasks)
  with a big workflow environment (~2.5mb) that often uses the YAQL
  function "<% env() %>". This function basically just returns the
  workflow environment.
* Created all necessary unit tests.
* Other style fixes.

Change-Id: Ie3169ec884ec9a0e7e50327dd03cd78dcda0a39b
'}]
commit_message:
Add "convert_output_data" config property for YAQL

* Adding "convert_output_data" config property gives an opportunity
  to increase overal performance. If YAQL always converts an expression
  result, it often takes significant CPU time and overall workflow
  execution time increases. It is especially important when a workflow
  publishes lots of data into the context and uses big workflow
  environments. It's been tested on a very big workflow (~7k tasks)
  with a big workflow environment (~2.5mb) that often uses the YAQL
  function "<% env() %>". This function basically just returns the
  workflow environment.
* Created all necessary unit tests.
* Other style fixes.

Change-Id: Ie3169ec884ec9a0e7e50327dd03cd78dcda0a39b

subject: [TRAIN] Backport tripleo-systemd-wrapper (squash)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-06 20:25:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/5efeefa70491f09d8167d9152b9c5b6890bfe214', 'message': '[TRAIN] Backport tripleo-systemd-wrapper (squash)

This is a combination of 4 commits.

This is the 1st commit message:

Implement tripleo-systemd-wrapper role

This patch adds a new role that will be used to manage side containers
with systemd instead of docker.socket or nsenter.  The main use case here
is Neutron, although this role is designed to work with any service.

This role will create a series of systemd files to monitor a file which
gets mounted into a container. Additionally a wrapper script is
generated which is mounted in the container that will provide the
arguments that should be used to launch new containers.

Blueprint: safe-side-containers
Change-Id: I4821b7ca0260e4dfd1717ba976cef700d160f84f
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 699249f1790dd5646556173bf5331e7e71135ad4)

This is the commit message #2:

Remove --rm=true from sidecar container sync

Neutron uses kill-scripts which remove the container after stopping it.
If the container is launched with docker and --rm=true, the container
will automatically be cleaned up and the $(CLI) rm <container id> in the
kill script with error out because the container can't be found.

Related-Bug: #1858662
Change-Id: I3d7940cb0816adce58e0fa778469dcec95302f67
(cherry picked from commit 17d97f2618e56be606c9307551efdaadda8dff69)

This is the commit message #3:

Fix substitution in kill-script

In the kill-script there is a string "Unknown action ${SIG} for
${$CT_NAME} ${CT_ID}" which results in a "bad substitution" error, as
there is no variable named with what the contents of the CT_NAME
environment variable contains.  Remove the extraneous '$'.

Change-Id: I4c76071083bf5cb4f876d3b78c379822a8bd8db1
Fixes-Bug: #1860155
(cherry picked from commit b45d4c6d219e8e27219bca341acdfd634155d6f6)

This is the commit message #4:

Add handling of signal 15 in kill script

The reason bug #1860155 was triggered was because the kill script did
not have a stanza for handling the signal that was passed in, which is
signal 15.  Since signal 15 is unhandled, keepalived processes will
still stick around.  Add handling for signal 15.

Change-Id: I632a3ef5ec137df10f647335f6354589c2316fd0
Related-bug: #1860155
(cherry picked from commit 06dc258a28784db98e44a3de488c204f01b97613)

commit_message:
[TRAIN] Backport tripleo-systemd-wrapper (squash)

This is a combination of 4 commits.

This is the 1st commit message:

Implement tripleo-systemd-wrapper role

This patch adds a new role that will be used to manage side containers
with systemd instead of docker.socket or nsenter.  The main use case here
is Neutron, although this role is designed to work with any service.

This role will create a series of systemd files to monitor a file which
gets mounted into a container. Additionally a wrapper script is
generated which is mounted in the container that will provide the
arguments that should be used to launch new containers.

Blueprint: safe-side-containers
Change-Id: I4821b7ca0260e4dfd1717ba976cef700d160f84f
Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 699249f1790dd5646556173bf5331e7e71135ad4)

This is the commit message #2:

Remove --rm=true from sidecar container sync

Neutron uses kill-scripts which remove the container after stopping it.
If the container is launched with docker and --rm=true, the container
will automatically be cleaned up and the $(CLI) rm <container id> in the
kill script with error out because the container can't be found.

Related-Bug: #1858662
Change-Id: I3d7940cb0816adce58e0fa778469dcec95302f67
(cherry picked from commit 17d97f2618e56be606c9307551efdaadda8dff69)

This is the commit message #3:

Fix substitution in kill-script

In the kill-script there is a string "Unknown action ${SIG} for
${$CT_NAME} ${CT_ID}" which results in a "bad substitution" error, as
there is no variable named with what the contents of the CT_NAME
environment variable contains.  Remove the extraneous '$'.

Change-Id: I4c76071083bf5cb4f876d3b78c379822a8bd8db1
Fixes-Bug: #1860155
(cherry picked from commit b45d4c6d219e8e27219bca341acdfd634155d6f6)

This is the commit message #4:

Add handling of signal 15 in kill script

The reason bug #1860155 was triggered was because the kill script did
not have a stanza for handling the signal that was passed in, which is
signal 15.  Since signal 15 is unhandled, keepalived processes will
still stick around.  Add handling for signal 15.

Change-Id: I632a3ef5ec137df10f647335f6354589c2316fd0
Related-bug: #1860155
(cherry picked from commit 06dc258a28784db98e44a3de488c204f01b97613)

commit_message:
[train-squash] Backport legacy log folder and readme cleanups

These 3 backports will save a bit of time during train deployments.

Ensure service log folder permissions

We should ensure that the service folders are 0750. We're setting
/var/log/containers but we should also ensure the service folders also
have the correct permissions.

Change-Id: I28e8017edc7e30a60288adf846da722fd6ab310e
(cherry picked from commit f2147c9974c5e4d9fec91e87a2a42a7c0b8c9d5d)

Drop legacy log folder and readme

We switched to containers a long time ago. This patch drops the
management of a /var/log/<service> directory and the creation of a
readme indicating that we've moved to containers which makes the logging
available under /var/log/containers/<service>

Change-Id: Ia4e991d5d937031ac3312f639b726a944743dd1e
(cherry picked from commit 7906fb43be72a150b5d10e0e18b21b568895b6e0)

Readd creation of /var/log/mariadb directory

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692850/ cleaned up the
legacy directories, but since then rhel8 jobs fails while
starting galera containers with error of missing
directory /var/log/mariadb, this patch adds it again.

Closes-Bug: #1851847
Change-Id: Iea081ecb3fc021fc796c93631ed6f663fd9580db
(cherry picked from commit 189d9b9211a65857cfd9191a00e9d86894af8293)

commit_message:
Release oslo.policy 3.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of oslo.policy to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I4cc6bd650704c9bcf52d93a1ef288b49d33b202d

commit_message:
Fix error logging of dev/functions

In case of failures in kayobe-overcloud-centos, the error message fails
with:
kayobe/dev/functions: line 569: LOGDIR: unbound variable

Example:
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/ce1fadc3ee6d4842a599da57a670cc18

This can be reproduced with:
set -eu

if [[ -n ${LOGDIR} ]]; then
    echo "LOGDIR set"
else
    echo "else"
fi

Fix the error reporting with assigning an empty string to LOGDIR by
default.

Change-Id: Ieef73950f89e4dfb727ddc59ef2750d9b81f3c58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/80/705180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Work around potential double row.delete() call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-19 14:50:16.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/9584a951c32d3f620ffb0cb0d5910fe528cf3a90', 'message': 'Work around potential double row.delete() call

The update_acls code can potentially iterate over the same ACL
twice. This temporary workaround silently ignores an attempt to
delete the same row twice in the same transaction, since that
should be safe. Ultimately, refactoring the ACL code to use sets
and possibly handle the fact that an ACL could be referenced from

Change-Id: I259c92116f7d3186ae5af45f1407052eb57ac0ba
Related-bug: #1857016
'}]
commit_message:
Work around potential double row.delete() call

The update_acls code can potentially iterate over the same ACL
twice. This temporary workaround silently ignores an attempt to
delete the same row twice in the same transaction, since that
should be safe. Ultimately, refactoring the ACL code to use sets
and possibly handle the fact that an ACL could be referenced from
multiple rows should be done.

Change-Id: I259c92116f7d3186ae5af45f1407052eb57ac0ba
Related-bug: #1857016
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/01/700001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: acl_del_obj.delete() except AssertionError: # If we try to delete a row twice, just continue pass

subject: Relax required Redfish fields handling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-13 00:24:29.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/resources/registry/message_registry.py', 'sushy/resources/base.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/registry/test_message_registry.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/3f08acc80369d0f226da87ab106682b68cb1c0ae', 'message': 'Relax required Redfish fields handling

Redfish defines some of the fields in its JSON schemas as
mandatory. However, some implementations ignore this requirement
and occasionally omit some required fields in the Redfish document
tree they produce.

Failing the whole Redfish interaction basing solely on the absence
of a required (bit non-essential) field makes sushy perfect, but not
exactly practical.

This patch changes to semantics of the `default` parameter in
``Field` constructor in a way that it can inhibit otherwise fatal
failure when a select of required attributes are missing.

Along this mis/feature, some non-essential fields in Redfish
message registry have been made required and defaulted effectively
making them non-required.

Change-Id: I637f11ff9ceab398077eae19db83db396356c8dc
Story: 2006641
Task: 38362
(cherry picked from commit 8440eb2826f14e579e0892ed3566f43bd86a888c)
'}]
commit_message:
Relax required Redfish fields handling

Redfish defines some of the fields in its JSON schemas as
mandatory. However, some implementations ignore this requirement
and occasionally omit some required fields in the Redfish document
tree they produce.

Failing the whole Redfish interaction basing solely on the absence
of a required (bit non-essential) field makes sushy perfect, but not
exactly practical.

This patch changes to semantics of the `default` parameter in
``Field` constructor in a way that it can inhibit otherwise fatal
failure when a select of required attributes are missing.

Along this mis/feature, some non-essential fields in Redfish
message registry have been made required and defaulted effectively
making them non-required.

Change-Id: I637f11ff9ceab398077eae19db83db396356c8dc
Story: 2006641
Task: 38362
(cherry picked from commit 8440eb2826f14e579e0892ed3566f43bd86a888c)

commit_message:
Add "live migration without performance impact" spec.

This spec proposes a way selectively disable live migration-related
features which will slow down guest performance.
It is useful for guest workloads that can't tolerate any potential
performance impact.

Change-Id: I474826eadde4ac47aa4b89e1b7fbffdfe39a4e11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/55/693655/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Live migration no performance impact ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-no-performance-impact Problem description =================== Auto converge and post copy are features from QEMU, for living migration can be completed. Auto converge will slow down the CPU speed and memory I/O speed to ensure memory can be copied to destination node. Post copy will boot an instance at destination node and access the memory from source node remotely. Currently auto converge and post copy can only be enabled/disabled via configuration, which means the configurations will effect all instance on the host during live migration. If an application which sensitive to reduced performance (some scientific computing applications may be more sensitive to memory access latency), and the instance is on a host with these options enabled, live migration may cause the application to raise an error. Therefore, the user wants to control whether to enable/disable auto converge or post copy during live migration. Use Cases --------- * As an administrator, I want the user can tag the instance request no performance impact themselves. * As an operator, I want the live migrate success and not take too long time. * As a user, I want the live migrate do not impact the performance for some performance sensitive applications. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to add no performance impact parameter to live migrate API call. The request for ``POST /servers/{server_id}/action`` where action is "os-migrateLive" will get a new optional parameter called ``no_performance_impact``. If the parameter is specified, it will disable auto converge and post copy during the live migration even if they are enabled in the configuration. .. note:: The new parameter would only affect the live migrate API call, it will not affect the force complete migration API call. .. note:: User can tag their instances as **no performance impact** via instance metadata or somewhere else, then operator can check the tag to decide whether add the new parameter before live migrate to avoid performance impact during the live migration. The form of the tag will not be specified in this spec, which should be negotiated by the administrator and operator, and inform the user how to use it. Alternatives ------------ * Another method is to expose "auto-converge" and "post-copy" in API. [1]_ This can be worked, but it expose the features of hypervisor directly. * We can expose "auto-converge" and "post-copy" in flavor extra specs and image properties. [2]_ But it have same issues as above, even expose the features to end users. It increases administrator management costs as well as operation and maintenance costs. Data model impact ----------------- A ``no_performance_impact`` boolean column, which defaults to False, will be added to the ``migrations`` DB table and related versioned object. REST API impact --------------- The request for ``POST /servers/{server_id}/action`` where action is "os-migrateLive" will get a new optional parameter called ``no_performance_impact``. A sample JSON request with ``no_performance_impact`` for living migrate a server would like this:: { "os-migrateLive": { . . . "no_performance_impact": true } } .. note:: If ``no_performance_impact`` not set in the request, it will default to **false**. ``no_performance_impact`` will be exposed through ``GET /os-migrations``, ``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations`` and ``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations/{migration_id}``. A sample JSON response would look like below for a migration:: { "migrations": [ { . . . "no_performance_impact": true } ] } Filtering/Sorting: The ``no_performance_impact`` key will be added to the existing list of valid sorting/filtering keys so that migrations can be filtered/sorted based on this field. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- User need tag their instance as **requested no performance impact** so that operator can filter these instance. Operator need filter instances which **request no performance impact** before live migrate to ensure that the instance's performance will not get a huge impact. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Ya Wang Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: Liaison Needed Work Items ---------- * Handle ``POST /servers/{server_id}/action`` on receiving an optional ``no_performance_impact`` parameter for living migrate action on the client side. * Expose the ``no_performance_impact`` through ``GET /os-migrations``, ``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations`` and ``GET /servers/{server_id}/migrations/{migration_id}``. * Recalculate ``_live_migration_flags`` before live migration start in the libvirt driver. * Support filtering and sorting servers on the ``no_performance_impact`` parameter. * Add tests code. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Test code will be included to test the new feature. Documentation Impact ==================== * The live migration document should be changed to introduce this new feature. References ========== .. [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/648619/ .. [2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651681/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ussuri - Introduced

subject: Fix 'None' field value processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-13 00:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/resources/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/ad426df30560ab202f0141f58875b4b0b3c392ed', 'message': 'Fix 'None' field value processing

Change [1] introduced a conditional call to Field's
"adapter" callable supposedly to work-around some OEM issues.
Sadly, the exact problem that change [1] has been trying to
solve was never explained and remains murky.

However, fix [1] has also introduced a bug which makes sushy

to sushy failing to operate on perfectly valid JSON documents.

This change removes most of the conditions guarding Field's
"adapter" function calls.

commit_message:
Fix 'None' field value processing

Change [1] introduced a conditional call to Field's
"adapter" callable supposedly to work-around some OEM issues.
Sadly, the exact problem that change [1] has been trying to
solve was never explained and remains murky.

However, fix [1] has also introduced a bug which makes sushy
ignoring 'None' literals in the values. This sometimes leads
to sushy failing to operate on perfectly valid JSON documents.

This change removes most of the conditions guarding Field's
"adapter" function calls.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669963/6

Change-Id: I8d1e1691a0bb2b6315894c85569a73633d34c1cb
(cherry picked from commit 1ec13aaba2d0b9c703a2564ec588e4d6de92697b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/08/707508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: try: # Get the value based on the name, defaulting to an empty dict # Check to ensure that value is implemented by OEM # TODO(etingof): we should revisit this logic/code if (item is not None and item != {} and str(item).lower() != 'none'): value = self._adapter(item) else: value = item return value

commit_message:
WIP: Add NodeOwnerFilter

This adds a traditional scheduler filter that will filter
ironic nodes by owner for non-admin users. The rules are:

* non-ironic nodes pass the filter as they do not apply
* admins have access to any node regardless of owning project
* non-admins only have access to the nodes their project owns
* nodes without an owner are not available to non-admins

The required version for openstacksdk gets bumped since we need
https://review.opendev.org/697179/ for the ironic virt driver.

Implements blueprint ironic-tenant-filter

Change-Id: I24e0a3dcbf956362f0b4c2d80e618993a528afb0

commit_message:
Allow overriding self.api in _build_minimal_create_server_request

Change I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424 removed the api
arg from _build_minimal_create_server_request and assumes the test
has a self.api attribute but not all functional tests have a single
self.api if they are doing multi-tenant testing.

This change adds an api kwarg to the method so multi-tenant tests
can provide the per-tenant api client they want to use to create
the server.

Change-Id: I2deeae11022a01298f0275dbc2e9d247893aa814

commit_message:
Fix workaround delegation when overcloud's name is not overcloud.

tripleo-ansible-inventory use overcloud as the name of the stack by
default.  On some ci, that value may be different, this then produces
an undercloud only inventory file.

Change-Id: Ic420c0717165e01df99ad2368a23fc9fc10e71c1
Closes-Bug: #1857120
(cherry picked from commit 6483436d7d0916e5e07fa38b9041e0fd7a5dde1f)

(cherry picked from commit 889259d861a53055e27c9aaaec7f370cd2596054)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-27 17:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['templates/workarounds.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/9d0a6880d6b59c4e785e9bcfd981be10e6257682', 'message': "Add new workarounds mechanism to apply workarounds via Ansible.

The tripleo-upgrade has a workarounds logic which allows us to
apply patches or specific modifications prior and after some of
the upgrade steps. However, if these workarouds need to be applied
in the overcloud nodes, the only way to do it was via a bash script
which would iterate over the nodes and apply the patch or perform a
change on each of the nodes.

This patch adds a new workarounds field: ansible_hosts. When this
option will be present in the workaround and it will be different
than an empty string then the workaround will be aplied via Ansible in
the nodes specified in that ansible_hosts field. This ansible_hosts
option needs to be used in combination with the command one, as
the command will be transformed in a shell Ansible task which will
be executed in the nodes passed in the ansible_hosts option.

Example:
pre_overcloud_upgrade_prepare_workarounds:
- set_root_password:
    patch: false
    basedir: ''

    ansible_hosts: 'overcloud'

cat ~/ansible_workarounds/set_root_password.yaml
- hosts: overcloud
  tasks:
    - name: set_root_password workaround
      shell: |
        echo redhat | passwd root --stdin

When executing the workarounds, a new bash function ansible_patch
has been included which will take care of executing the generated
Ansible playbook.

Also, an optional input parameter could be passed to workarounds.sh,
when passed, it will be taken as input for the --limit option when
executing ansible-playbook. This way, we can execute a workaround
specifically in a server, instead of running it in all of them.

Change-Id: I421ebecfc5504ac2fd225de0c4fb0cbf735bbdaf
(cherry picked from commit e582d2f30473f714260c620d5c0d3807009aa797)

commit_message:
Add new workarounds mechanism to apply workarounds via Ansible.

The tripleo-upgrade has a workarounds logic which allows us to
apply patches or specific modifications prior and after some of
the upgrade steps. However, if these workarouds need to be applied
in the overcloud nodes, the only way to do it was via a bash script
which would iterate over the nodes and apply the patch or perform a
change on each of the nodes.

This patch adds a new workarounds field: ansible_hosts. When this
option will be present in the workaround and it will be different
than an empty string then the workaround will be aplied via Ansible in
the nodes specified in that ansible_hosts field. This ansible_hosts
option needs to be used in combination with the command one, as
the command will be transformed in a shell Ansible task which will
be executed in the nodes passed in the ansible_hosts option.

Example:
pre_overcloud_upgrade_prepare_workarounds:
- set_root_password:
    patch: false
    basedir: ''
    id: ''
    ansible_hosts: 'overcloud'
    command: |
        echo redhat | passwd root --stdin

will turn into a set_root_password.yaml Ansible playbook under
~/ansible_workarounds:

cat ~/ansible_workarounds/set_root_password.yaml
- hosts: overcloud
  tasks:
    - name: set_root_password workaround
      shell: |
        echo redhat | passwd root --stdin

When executing the workarounds, a new bash function ansible_patch
has been included which will take care of executing the generated
Ansible playbook.

Also, an optional input parameter could be passed to workarounds.sh,
when passed, it will be taken as input for the --limit option when
executing ansible-playbook. This way, we can execute a workaround
specifically in a server, instead of running it in all of them.

Change-Id: I421ebecfc5504ac2fd225de0c4fb0cbf735bbdaf
(cherry picked from commit e582d2f30473f714260c620d5c0d3807009aa797)
(cherry picked from commit b6bac90695acecb5206227836747c7ef4f7a0ce2)
(cherry picked from commit 81035c28daf0ecd1caf3a5735afc13ffdf62d4c4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/65/704365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # These arguments are only used when the workaround contains # the ansible_hosts option. # Args: # -l|--limit: Host to be passed in the --limit option when # calling ansible-playbook. If not argument passed # no --limit will be used = --limit all. # -u|--ssh-ansible-user: User to be passed when creating the # tripleo-inventory. Defaults to heat-admin. function usage { echo "Usage: ${0} [ [-l|--limit <ansible_host_to_limit>] [-u|--ssh-ansible-user <ansible_ssh_user_for_inventory>]]" } function ansible_patch { local ansible_filename=$1 local ansible_limit="" local ansible_ssh_user="heat-admin" local ansible_dir=$HOME/ansible_workarounds if [ ! -z $LIMIT ] then ansible_limit="--limit ${LIMIT}" fi if [ ! -z $ANSIBLE_SSH_USER ] then ansible_ssh_user=$ANSIBLE_SSH_USER fi inventory_file=${ansible_dir}/tripleo-inventory.yaml if [ ! -f "$inventory_file" ]; then source {{ undercloud_rc }} tripleo-ansible-inventory --ansible_ssh_user ${ansible_ssh_user} --static-yaml-inventory ${inventory_file} fi # Run ansible playbook ansible-playbook -v -i ${inventory_file} --become --become-user root ${ansible_dir}/${ansible_filename}.yaml ${ansible_limit} } # Global vars LIMIT="" ANSIBLE_SSH_USER="" while [[ $# -gt 0 ]] do key="$1" case $key in -l|--limit) LIMIT="$2" shift # past argument shift # past value ;; -u|--ssh-ansible-user) ANSIBLE_SSH_USER="$2" shift # past argument shift # past value ;; -h|--help) usage exit 1 ;; *) usage exit 1 # unknown option ;; esac done {% elif value.ansible_hosts is defined and value.ansible_hosts != '' -%} [ -d $HOME/ansible_workarounds ] || mkdir $HOME/ansible_workarounds cat <<'EOF' > "$HOME/ansible_workarounds/{{ key }}.yaml" - hosts: {{ value.ansible_hosts }} tasks: - name: {{key}} workaround shell: | {{ value.command | indent(width=8) }} EOF ansible_patch {{ key }}

Enable Ceph RGW 'account in url' option

This requires an update of the endpoint but is necessary to be able
to use public-readable containers (like temporary URLs) with RGW.

Some messges in the MessageRegistry are not having fields like
'Description' and 'Severity'. Most of the time the string in
'Message' and 'Description' fields are same. This fix proposes
to make 'Description' as not-required field and setting the
'Severity' field to default value of 'CRITICAL' if its missing
in the messages of MessageRegistry.

Example of a message in a MessageRegistry
"UpdateFailed": {
  "Message": "The update failed with a component specific error (%1).",
  "NumberOfArgs": 1,
  "ParamTypes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "Resolution": "Retry the update after remedying the component error."
}

commit_message:
Handle incomplete messages in MessageRegistry

Some messges in the MessageRegistry are not having fields like
'Description' and 'Severity'. Most of the time the string in
'Message' and 'Description' fields are same. This fix proposes
to make 'Description' as not-required field and setting the
'Severity' field to default value of 'CRITICAL' if its missing
in the messages of MessageRegistry.

Example of a message in a MessageRegistry
"UpdateFailed": {
  "Message": "The update failed with a component specific error (%1).",
  "NumberOfArgs": 1,
  "ParamTypes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "Resolution": "Retry the update after remedying the component error."
}

Story: 2007216
Task: 38467
Change-Id: I3e9e2ee0867f59684c24e60772a5318801891521
(cherry picked from commit 9e12fbf109eff84ff31735a690dd010ecc4df24e)

commit_message:
Filter nodes by owner (spec)

Add a scheduler filter to restrict non-admins to only baremetal nodes
that they own.

Spec for blueprint ironic-tenant-filter

Change-Id: I4e160ac115a1e6717df5bd5daeccaba83bf916a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/17/697717/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================== Filter nodes by owner ===================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/ironic-tenant-filter Add a scheduler filter to restrict non-admins to only baremetal nodes that they own. Problem description =================== Nova interacts with Ironic as a user with administrative privileges which means it is able to provision any available baremetal node. Nova needs to be aware of Ironic's multi-tenant features so that it only attempts to use baremetal nodes that belong to the tenant initiating the provisioning request with Nova. [1]_ Use Cases --------- As a cloud provider, I want to assign one or more nodes to a tenant and then have those tenants restricted to those nodes when creating a baremetal server using the compute service. Proposed change =============== Ironic nodes have an optional "owner" field [2]_ which can be a project ID. This blueprint would use that owner field to filter nodes based on owner. The compute service will report the node owner via the ``ComputeNode.stats`` attribute that is already used today to report node capabilities to the scheduler filters. Note that if the owner of an available node is changed the new owner will not be reported to the ``nova-scheduler`` service until the ``update_available_resource`` periodic task runs on the ``nova-compute`` service. This spec does not propose any sort of external server event changes in the API or listening for notifications from ironic for node changes. A new (traditional) scheduler filter will be added [3]_ which will be used to filter nodes by the ``RequestSpec.project_id`` field for non-admins. The following rules will apply to the filter: * non-ironic nodes pass the filter as they do not apply * admins have access to any available node regardless of owner * non-admins only have access to the nodes they own * nodes without an owner are not available to non-admins Alternatives ------------ I initially tried writing a placement pre-filter [4]_ using a required trait for the node owner but that does not work since it incorrectly filtered out non-ironic nodes which will break a mixed hypervisor deployment. We also cannot use the `AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation`_ filter because that relies on host aggregates which are `not supported`_ at the node level. .. _AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html#aggregatemultitenancyisolation .. _not supported: https://review.opendev.org/526753/ Data model impact ----------------- None, though the RequestSpec object might need to grow a field to indicate if the request is coming from an admin. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- This should improve security by restricting tenants to only the nodes that they own. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ An additional scheduler filter means more time will be taken overall during scheduling but the filter will be disabled by default and even when enabled the filter should be fast. Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployers that wish to use this feature will need to ensure their tenant users own baremetal nodes and then enable the filter. Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None. While there could be provisioned nodes without an owner in an existing deployment, the nova instances for those nodes cannot be migrated to another compute host so they will not go through the scheduler and fail the new filter. In other words, the new filter is essentially only enforced when creating new baremetal servers. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: mriedem <mriedem.os@gmail.com> Other contributors: Potentially `MOC`_ developers .. _MOC: https://github.com/CCI-MOC/esi Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: mriedem Work Items ---------- * Update the openstacksdk to get the node owner field (done [5]_) * Update the ironic virt driver code to expose the node owner, if set, in the ``ComputeNode.stats`` field during the ``update_available_resource`` routine. * Add a new ``NodeOwnerFilter`` scheduler filter. * Tests and docs. Dependencies ============ While not a strict dependency ironic needs to restrict the ability to change the owner of a provisioned node [6]_. Testing ======= Unit and functional tests. Documentation Impact ==================== Within nova the scheduler filter docs should be updated [7]_ [8]_. Within ironic the scheduler filter should be mentioned, perhaps in the install and configuration guide [9]_. References ========== .. [1] MOC request: https://github.com/CCI-MOC/esi/blob/master/docs/upstream-features.md#nova-baremetal-filters-that-are-aware-of-ironic-multi-tenancy .. [2] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/webapi-version-history.html#id7 .. [3] NodeOwnerFilter: https://review.opendev.org/697331 .. [4] Pre-filter PoC: https://review.opendev.org/697187 .. [5] openstacksdk change: https://review.opendev.org/697179/ .. [6] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011385.html .. [7] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html .. [8] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/filter-scheduler.html .. [9] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-compute.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ussuri - Introduced

commit_message:
Use PCPU and VCPU in one instance

We'd like to propose a way to create instance to
take using of PCPU and VCPU resource in one instance.

Re-proposed in U release.

Change-Id: I0c4ffe349dc9381c83c836efb4af99d072169c88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/56/668656/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. ================================= Use PCPU and VCPU in One Instance ================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance The spec `CPU resource tracking`_ splits host CPUs into the ``PCPU`` resources and the ``VCPU`` resources, make it possible to run instances of ``dedicated`` CPU allocation policy and instances of ``shared`` CPU allocation policy on the same host. This spec aims to create an instance with partial instance CPUs running with ``dedicated`` CPU allocation policy and allocated from ``PCPU`` resource class, and the rest instance CPUs running in ``shared`` policy and allocating from ``VCPU`` resource class. Problem description =================== The current CPU allocation policies, ``dedicated`` or ``shared``, are applied to while CPUs of an instance, after the introduction of `CPU resource tracking`_ it is possible to propose a more fine-grained CPU allocation policy, which is based the control over individual instance CPU, to specify the ``dedicated`` or ``shared`` CPU allocation policy to each instance CPU. Use Cases --------- As a NFV user, I want CPUs of different performance priority to meet the characterization of workloads from different sub-module. One example is the OVS workload, in which the CPUs for the data plane are usually required to respond to network traffic as quick as possible to seek the high performance, while the control plane CPUs may not have too much pressure on performance and could be assigned with CPUs that shared by other instances. This proposal in this spec could help to deploy more similar OVS nodes on the same host without force all instance CPUs to occupy the host CPUs exclusively. As a Kubernetes administrator I wish to run a multi-tier or auto-scaling application in Kubernetes, which is running in single OpenStack VM, with the expectation that using dedicated high performance CPUs for application itself and deploying the containers on shared cores. Proposed change =============== Tracking the dedicated CPUs of instance --------------------------------------- Add a new extra specs and image metadata:: ``hw:cpus.dedicated=<cpuset string>`` or ``hw_cpus.dedicated=<cpuset string>`` Image metadata ``hw_cpus.dedicated`` only works when extra specs ``hw:cpus.dedicated`` is not set in the instance flavor properties. The CPUs appeared in list of ``hw:cpus.dedicated`` or ``hw_cpus.dedicated`` will be allocated from host's ``PCPU`` resource, which is called the instance ``dedicated`` CPUs. The CPUs specified in ``<cpuset string>`` are expected to be a sub set or the same value of CPU list specified in instance ``flavor.cpuset``, and the CPUs that appear in ``cpuset`` but not in the list of the ``dedicated`` CPU list will be allocated from host's ``VCPU`` resource and called the instance ``shared`` CPUs. An instance that the ``dedicated`` CPU list is not empty implies it is a NUMA awareness instance and the extra specs ``hw:numa_nodes`` is set to 1 if it is not set in the flavor properties:: flavor: vcpus=4 memory_mb=512 extra_specs: hw:cpus.dedicated=0,2 New instance CPU policy based on single vCPU ---------------------------------------------- ``CPUAllocationPolicy.DEDICATED`` and ``CPUAllocationPolicy.SHARED`` are the current instance CPU allocation policies, which are applied to all CPUs belonging to the instance. This proposal brings an instance CPU allocation policy in a granularity of single instance CPU, the CPU appeared in the instance ``dedicated`` CPU list will be allocated from host's ``PCPU`` resource class, and the instance CPU is not shown in the ``dedicated`` CPU list will be allocated from ``VCPU`` resource class. To keep compatibility, if extra specs ``hw:cpus.dedicated`` or image metadata ``hw_cpus.dedicated`` is not empty, instance CPU allocation policy specified in ``hw:cpu_policy`` or ``hw_cpu_policy`` will be omitted. Otherwise the old fashion CPU allocation policy will be used. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- ``InstanceNUMACell`` needs to be upgraded to track the ``dedicated`` CPUs that belong to particular instance NUMA node. It is expected that ``NUMACell`` object is also upgraded in the implementation of `CPU resource tracking`_ for tracking the host NUMA specific ``PCPU`` resources. Since the code of `CPU resource tracking`_ is not ready until now, the final changes toward ``NUMACell`` object needs to be reviews after the code has been accepted. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ ``InstanceNUMACell`` and ``NUMACell`` will be changed, this brings some extra criteria to in Nova scheduler's filtering and weight layers, but the performance impact should be pretty trivial. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- New extra spec and image metadata have been introduced to set CPU allocation policy for individual instance CPU. The ``hw:cpu_policy`` extra spec as well as the image metadata ``hw_cpu_policy`` works in the old fashion when ``hw:cpus.dedicated`` or ``hw_cpus.dedicated`` is not specified in instance flavor. Implementation ============== Code of dependency spec `CPU resource tracking`_ is still in coding, it is expected that some there is some code in creating the CPU mapping between instance NUMA cell ``shared`` vCPUs and some host NUMA cell VCPUs through libvirt driver. Both host and instance NUMA cell need to track the PCPU information and it is required to modify the ``NUMACell`` and ``InstanceNUMACell`` objects to keep the ``dedicated`` CPUs. The ``shared`` CPUs are the remaining CPUs that no showing in the host or instance NUMA cell ``dedicated`` CPU list. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Wang, Huaqiang <huaqiang.wang@intel.com> Other contributors: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com> Work Items ---------- * Add new extra spec and image metadata for ``dedicated`` CPUs * Change the default CPU allocation policy * Report dedicated and shared host CPUs per NUMA cell to DB if required * Report dedicated and shared instance CPUs per NUMA cell to DB Dependencies ============ * `CPU resource tracking`_: The proposing spec is based on the ``PCPU`` resource and ``VCPU`` resource defined in this spec. And the final implementation of this spec is a hard dependency. Testing ======= The unit tests and functional tests will be required. Documentation Impact ==================== The administrator document should be added to introduce the usage of extra spec ``hw:cpu.dedicated`` and notice the compatibility with ``hw:cpu_policy``. References ========== * `Support shared and dedicated VMs on same host`_ * `CPU resource tracking`_ * `Proposes NUMA topology with RPs`_ .. _Support shared and dedicated VMs on same host: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545734/ .. _CPU resource tracking: https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/src/branch/master/specs/train/approved/cpu-resources.rst .. _Proposes NUMA topology with RPs: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/552924/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Train - Introduced

commit_message:
Allow specify user to reset password

The blueprint proposes to allow the user to reset their password.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Qiu Fossen
Blueprint: allow-specify-user-to-reset-password

Change-Id: If2d28b796d782937647cf9d47a54ffb1db993411
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/02/682302/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Allow specify user to reset password ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/allow-specify-user-to-reset-password The blueprint proposes to allow the root/administrator to specify user to reset their password. Problem description =================== Currently, the Linux operating system supports the root user to reset it's own password, and the window operating system supports the administrator to reset it's own password, but they are cannot reset the normal user's password. In fact, a server has more than one user (contains root or administrator) in the production environment. Sometimes, because the user does not log in for a long time, the password is forgotten. Or the current user leaves, need to reset user password. Use Cases --------- As an administrator, I would like to specify the existing user of the server to reset its password. Proposed change =============== Add a new microversion to the the changePassword Action API. Change the api-ref description of the changePassword Action API. Add ``userName`` and ``userPass`` to the changePassword Action API's request body. Provide a new request body containing only the ``userName`` and ``userPass`` parameters. Compatible with the original request parameters, the users with the administrative role or the owner of the server can set ``userName=root`` or ``userName=administrator`` to change administrative password. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- In a new microversion, add the ``userName`` and ``userPass`` parameters to the changePassword Action API. URL: /servers/{server_id}/actions * Request method: POST (changePassword Action) .. code-block:: json { "changePassword" : { "userName": "foo", "userPass": "bar" } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- If the specified user doesn't exist in the server's user list, we will catch the exception in nova-api, and that cannot reset the server's status to ERROR. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Brin Zhang Other contributors: Qiu Fossen Work Items ---------- * Add a new microversion to the changePassword Action API. * Add ``userName`` and ``userPass`` parameters to the request body. * Add ``userName`` and ``userPass`` support in python-novaclient and python-openstackclient. * Add related tests. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add related unit test. * Add related functional test (API samples). Tempest testing should not be necessary for this change. Documentation Impact ==================== Update the API reference for the affected API. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ussuri - Introduced

commit_message:
Allow compute nodes to use DISK_GB from shared storage RP

Allow compute node resource providers to use DISK_GB inventory
configured in a shared storage resource provider by using
aggregate relationship.

Shared resource providers are marked with a standard trait
called `MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE`. This indicates that the
provider allows its inventory to be consumed by other resource
providers associated via an aggregate link.

Blueprint: support-shared-storage-resource-provider
Change-Id: I0d64d785dc96f37cb8a7d5ac182bc14dcc6502a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/88/650188/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================================== Allow compute nodes to use shared storage provider for DISK_GB resources ======================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-shared-storage-resource-provider Allow compute node resource providers to use DISK_GB inventory configured in a shared storage resource provider by using aggregate relationship. Shared resource providers are marked with a standard trait called `MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE`. This indicates that the provider allows its inventory to be consumed by other resource providers associated via an aggregate link. For example, assume we have two compute nodes, CN_1 and CN_2, each with inventory of VCPU and MEMORY_MB but not DISK_GB (in other words, these are compute nodes with no local disk). There is a resource provider called "NFS_SHARE" that has an inventory of DISK_GB and has the MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE trait. Both the "CN_1" and "CN_2" compute node resource providers and the "NFS_SHARE" resource provider are associated with an aggregate called "AGG_1". Problem description =================== In Rocky release, Patch [1]_ was reverted back due to below reasons as reported in LP bug 1784020 [2]_. #. On upgrade from previous release, any existing allocations against the compute node provider's DISK_GB inventory will not allow removal of the DISK_GB inventory from the compute node provider during the update_available_resource periodic task. In other words, we have no data migration routine in place to move DISK_GB allocations from the compute node provider to the shared storage provider in Rocky. #. During a move operation, we move the instance's allocations from the source compute node provider to the migration record, then go through the scheduler to pick a dest host for the instance and allocate resources against the destination host (and optionally shared storage provider). So, * The DISK_GB allocation from the instance to the shared storage provider is deleted for a short window of time during scheduling until we pick a destination host. * If cold migrate fails or is reverted, we delete the allocations (created by the scheduler) and move the allocations from the migration record (against the source node provider) back to the instance, but because we failed to move the DISK_GB allocation against the sharing provider as pointed in above point for the instance to the migration record, we've lost that DISK_GB allocation when copying it back to the instance on revert/failure. #. Live migration and evacuation fails when APIs are called with `force` flag as it bypasses scheduler thereby completely ignoring shared resource provider allocations. #. The hypervisor details shows incorrect DISK_GB related data. Use Cases --------- #. Allow compute node resource providers to use NFS or any other shared storage systems for storing instance files and report it's correct disk usages in the shared storage resource providers instead of respective compute node resource providers. #. Avoid the need for ssh access across compute hosts during a resize if those hosts are using the same shared storage resource provider as described in specs `resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys spec <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551927>`_. Proposed change =============== Need patch [3]_ changes so that libvirt driver doesn't report DISK_GB inventory if it's in a shared storage provider aggregate relationship. Upgrade DISK_GB from compute node to shared storage resource provider ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Add data migration routine using reshape functionality which will do following things at the startup of the compute service: 1. Check if compute node is configured to use DISK_GB resources from a shared resource provider and the DISK_GB resource is also present in the compute node root resource provider. If above condition is True, it means Reshape is needed. 2. Add a new data migration metho to move the allocations of DISK_GB resource from compute node resource provider to the shared storage resource provider. Move operation ----------------- During moving allocations from instance to the migration record, if placement service goes down or for some unknown reasons the cold migration fails, then we can make use of `orig_alloc` which holds the original allocations of an instance to add these allocations back to the instance. To do this, `replace_allocation_with_migration` method will need to be modified to set `orig_alloc` to MigrationTask._held_allocations object and take necessary actions in rollback method. Live migration and evacuation ------------------------------- In Stein release in microversion 2.68, force flag is removed from live migration and evacuation. So users are encouraged to use this microversion to avert issues as mentioned in problem description in Point 3. Show correct DISK_GB data in hypervisor details ------------------------------------------------ When a compute node is configured to use DISK_GB resources from a shared storage resource provider, it won't report DISK_GB resources in the inventory. The resource tracker will get the actual disk resources information from a shared storage resource provider and update "local_gb" and "free_disk_gb" so that correct information is available when a hypervisor usage is queried. The calculation of "local_gb_used" logic will remain intact. Alternatives ------------ As of today it's possible to configure shared storage resource providers with the compute nodes using `MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE` in Placement service and use it in Nova but it comes with caveats as described in bug [2]_. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Operator will need to perform below steps to enable this functionality:- 1. Create a shared storage resource provider for e.g. NFS_SHARE 2. Add "DISK_GB" inventory to NFS_SHARE 3. Add `MISC_SHARES_VIA_AGGREGATE` trait to NFS_SHARE 4. Create an aggregate for e.g. "AGG_1" 5. Associate "NFS_SHARE" share resource provider and all compute nodes which you want to use "DISK_GB" inventory from "NFS_SHARE" shared provider with an aggregate "AGG_1" Developer impact ---------------- Planning to implement this change only in libvirt driver as "update_provider_tree" method is not supported in some of the other hypervisors except "powervm". Upgrade impact -------------- If a compute node is configured to use DISK_GB resources from a shared resource provider in a `Train` release, then it will be detected automatically during the startup of the compute service and it will take following actions: 1. Check if compute node is configured to use DISK_GB resources from a shared resource provider and the DISK_GB resource is also present in the compute node root resource provider. If above condition is True, it means Reshape is needed. 2. In the data migration method, it will move the allocations of DISK_GB resource from compute node resource provider to the shared storage resource provider. From operator perspective, he/she will need to configure shared storage resource provider and simply restart the compute service and the migration of allocations from compute node to the shared storage resource provider will happen seamlessly. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: shilpa.devharakar <shilpa.devharakar@nttdata.com> Other contributors: Other developers from NTT Work Items ---------- * libvirt driver doesn't report DISK_GB inventory [3]_ * Add data migration routine using reshape functionality to move DISK_GB allocations from the compute node provider to the shared storage resource provider. * Add multi-node CI gate job to support shared storage providers * Add documentation to explain how to setup shared storage resource provider and how to use it. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Need a shared storage provider CI jobs setup. There is already a patch up [4]_ on the gerrit to setup a single node job. * We would also need a multi-node shared storage CI job to really say we support shared storage providers as a feature in Nova. Documentation Impact ==================== Add documentation to explain how to configure shared storage resource providers and how to use it. References ========== .. [1] libvirt Revert non-reporting DISK_GB if sharing: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586614 .. [2] Shared storage providers are not supported and will break things if used: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1784020 .. [3] libvirt Don't report DISK_GB if sharing: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560459 .. [4] Create shared storage resource provider for DISK_GB inventory: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586363 History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Train - Introduced

commit_message:
Python 3: Use distro_python_version for dev mode

In dev mode currently the python source is mounted under python2.7
site-packages. This change fixes this to use the distro_python_version
variable to ensure dev mode works with Python 3 images.

Change-Id: Ieae3778a02f1b79023b4f1c20eff27b37f481077
Partially-Implements: blueprint python-3
(cherry picked from commit 5a786436be1ec9198b7e6e61bfcb7b37f79fa880)

commit_message:
Add Eyal's review address to Vitrage liaisons

Eyal Bar-Ilan is using a different address for reviews than
the one defined in governance. Add the review address to
the Vitrage release liaisons so that check-ptl-approval
works as intended.

Change-Id: I520d75f39ef5f458e085df3f56573af68258811f

commit_message:
CI: Fix deploy guide jobs

This fixes files relevant for them because k-a uses common files
for both docs and deploy guide.
We need this to finally get rid of Rocky mentions despite our
recent fixes to docs.

Change-Id: I46c564f3d3e53c54148186fbadfd7380c4f2fd30

commit_message:
add Linaro repo with fixed libvirt

We want to migrate Linaro Developer Cloud to train release. But this
requires fixing libvirt to work on ThunderX1 servers [1].

1. https://bugs.linaro.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3778

This change adds repository to default ones and pin it in a way that
everything other than libvirt is ignored.

manual cherry-pick of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706705/

Change-Id: I56525cdc357e187ee6f3adae068a37cd013a9fce

commit_message:
Fix sphinx8 script used by pep8

We wrap doc8 to register the directives we use in our documentation.
Previously the 'app' argument was passed as None, however sphinx has
started to use the argument.

This change uses a mock object since we don't need to use the
application object.

Change-Id: Id9e8d5f6d09f14d294cd493538780456f98c7dbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/24/707624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock # Sphinx expects an 'app' argument to these functions. Use a mock since we # don't need to use the application object. app = mock.Mock() sphinx.directives.setup(app) sphinx.directives.code.setup(app) sphinx.directives.patches.setup(app)

commit_message:
Expose options for Kibana load balancing

In order to load balance between multiple Kibana instances, they must
share common encryption keys for cookies and Elasticsearch reports.
This commit allows these common keys to be optionally applied to Kibana.
If not specified, as is the default they aren't set, and Kibana defaults
to unique per-instance keys as before.

Change-Id: I873e9d22d3c6bf687305c6620097b9140df72f89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/81/706781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
