commit_message:
Update journalbeat name to use hostname

Currently, journalbeat sets the beat name under which it appears in Kibana
to 'journalbeat'. This is unlike the other beats, which don't set the value,
and therefore default to using the hostname, whilst containing the beat.type
field denoting the beat type. This commit changes the journalbeat
configuration to match the other beats, in order to standardise the output
data in Elasticsearch and Kibana.

Change-Id: Ib43c7e89e6b037f4a6c260f3375f491b65750bd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/51/706951/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Configure Glance TCP socket after the store initialization
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-03 19:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/wsgi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/d9902c26a1f75149793b92d92968c40288f3d9ae', 'message': 'Configure Glance TCP socket after the store initialization

When multiple stores are being used with rbd backend, Glance tries
to get fsid of the cluster using rados library.
If even one of the rbd backends is unavailable, glance-api wsgi fails
to start properly, but continue listening on the TCP socket and is not
responding at any request until the timeout.

This change moves socket configuration after the store initialization
to make sure that failed Glance API process will not be
considered as up by the haproxy TCP check.

Change-Id: I4298bb835ec60b79a0010e52318ada19eb24ad80
Related-Bug: #1861723
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Glance TCP socket after the store initialization

When multiple stores are being used with rbd backend, Glance tries
to get fsid of the cluster using rados library.
If even one of the rbd backends is unavailable, glance-api wsgi fails
to start properly, but continue listening on the TCP socket and is not
responding at any request until the timeout.

This change moves socket configuration after the store initialization
to make sure that failed Glance API process will not be
considered as up by the haproxy TCP check.

Change-Id: I4298bb835ec60b79a0010e52318ada19eb24ad80
Related-Bug: #1861723
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/26/705526/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make RBD imagebackend flatten method idempotent

If glance and nova are both configured with RBD backend, but glance
does not return location information from the API, nova will fail to
clone the image from glance pool and will download it from the API.
In this case, image will be already flat, and subsequent flatten call
will fail.

This commit makes flatten call idempotent, so that it ignores already
flat images by catching ImageUnacceptable when requesting parent info
from ceph.

Closes-Bug: 1860990
Change-Id: Ia6c184c31a980e4728b7309b2afaec4d9f494ac3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/704330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(vdrok): only flatten images if they are not already flattened, # meaning that parent info is present try: self.driver.parent_info(self.rbd_name, pool=self.driver.pool) except exception.ImageUnacceptable: # No parent info, the image is already flat, it is a noop pass else: self.driver.flatten(self.rbd_name, pool=self.driver.pool)

commit_message:
Add webpack build configuration and new boilerplate

This commit adds initial configuration needed to begin refactoring
existing code to use webpack, ES6, a lightweight React alternative,
and Redux. The end goal of this series of patches is to dramatically
reduce the final build size while improving performance and
testability; for more details, rationale, and implementation plans,
see: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/stackviz-refactor

While the refactoring is in progress, the existing stable codebase
will remain untouched until the new build is stable and reaches
feature parity. Instructions for switching to the new build system
and codebase have been added to README.rst.

Change-Id: If9745f95efbbabc98fd95ba4cf95a4e5687eac50

commit_message:
Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed

commit_message:
Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: I1105c16caaf916e9101b6dca34a7f13936ce2240

It also requires a filesystem that sets ``atime`` on the files # when accessed.
deleted_lines: # List of enabled Image Import Methods# Both 'glance-direct' and 'web-download' are enabled by default.# Related options: # * [DEFAULT]/node_staging_uri (list value) #enabled_import_methods = [glance-direct,web-download]# * The ``sqlite`` driver uses a sqlite database (which sits on every glance # node locally) to track the usage of cached images. # * The ``xattr`` driver uses the extended attributes of files to store this # information. It also requires a filesystem that sets ``atime`` on the # files # when accessed.# * sheepdog# * sheepdog# sheepdog - <No description provided># DEPRECATED: # Chunk size for images to be stored in Sheepdog data store. # # Provide an integer value representing the size in mebibyte # (1048576 bytes) to chunk Glance images into. The default # chunk size is 64 mebibytes. # # When using Sheepdog distributed storage system, the images are # chunked into objects of this size and then stored across the # distributed data store to use for Glance. # # Chunk sizes, if a power of two, help avoid fragmentation and # enable improved performance. # # Possible values: # * Positive integer value representing size in mebibytes. # # Related Options: # * None # # (integer value) # Minimum value: 1 # This option is deprecated for removal since Train. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: # The Sheepdog project is no longer actively maintained. The # Sheepdog driver is scheduled for removal in the 'U' development # cycle. #sheepdog_store_chunk_size = 64 # DEPRECATED: # Port number on which the sheep daemon will listen. # # Provide an integer value representing a valid port number on # which you want the Sheepdog daemon to listen on. The default # port is 7000. # # The Sheepdog daemon, also called 'sheep', manages the storage # in the distributed cluster by writing objects across the storage # network. It identifies and acts on the messages it receives on # the port number set using ``sheepdog_store_port`` option to store # chunks of Glance images. # # Possible values: # * A valid port number (0 to 65535) # # Related Options: # * sheepdog_store_address # # (port value) # Minimum value: 0 # Maximum value: 65535 # This option is deprecated for removal since Train. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: # The Sheepdog project is no longer actively maintained. The # Sheepdog driver is scheduled for removal in the 'U' development # cycle. #sheepdog_store_port = 7000 # DEPRECATED: # Address to bind the Sheepdog daemon to. # # Provide a string value representing the address to bind the # Sheepdog daemon to. The default address set for the 'sheep' # is 127.0.0.1. # # The Sheepdog daemon, also called 'sheep', manages the storage # in the distributed cluster by writing objects across the storage # network. It identifies and acts on the messages directed to the # address set using ``sheepdog_store_address`` option to store # chunks of Glance images. # # Possible values: # * A valid IPv4 address # * A valid IPv6 address # * A valid hostname # # Related Options: # * sheepdog_store_port # # (host address value) # This option is deprecated for removal since Train. # Its value may be silently ignored in the future. # Reason: # The Sheepdog project is no longer actively maintained. The # Sheepdog driver is scheduled for removal in the 'U' development # cycle. #sheepdog_store_address = 127.0.0.1

commit_message:
Copy existing image in multiple stores

Added new import method 'copy-image' which will copy existing image into
specified list of stores. Introduced additional task which will serve
as internal plugin which will allow copying existing image into staging
area and then this data will be uploaded to specified stores via regula
import flow.

NOTE: This new import method 'copy-image' is only supported if multiple
stores are enabled in deployment.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint copy-existing-image
Change-Id: I13eaab7ab013f44ce18465bdbdbe8052942570ff

commit_message:
Add docs warning for PING health monitors

This patch adds a warning box to the load balancer cookbook clarifying
that the health monitor type of 'PING' should only be used in specific
cases.
This was called out in release notes, but was not clear in the cookbook.

Change-Id: I6b95891bec82e01c44b288cbe9796b1f87a07c32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/26/707426/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. warning:: Health monitors of type ``PING`` only check if the member is reachable and responds to ICMP echo requests. It will not detect if your application running on that instance is healthy or not. Most pools should use one of the other health monitor options. ``PING`` should only be used in specific cases where an ICMP echo request is a valid health check.

commit_message:
Donot remove virtualenv for RHEL-8

Since RHEL-8 virtualenv rpm works fine and is not incompatible.
Removing venv there breaks the whole RHEL8 jobs. So keep the
workaround for CentOS 7 only.

For CentOS-8, we will be using Python3 so it will not affect.

Closes-Bug: #1862909

Change-Id: I197c32308c9a33378d1f97f3949727303697a4e7
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use stable upper-constraints.txt in Amphora builds

Amphora builds are now using upper-constraints.txt file from master.
This is incorrect and makes the build fail as some newer versions of
libs are not available for Python 3. This commit makes sure the file is
taken from stable/train branch.

Change-Id: Ifacbd1953c3d8719539a9f4012eb34669bb164e2

commit_message:
trivial: Cleanup tox.ini

Update the minversion parameter to use the python -m pip to install
python packages:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/changelog.html#id185

Inherit the jobs requirements to simplify maintainance.

Also remove pypy from tox since it's not official supported anymore
and no target exist for it.

Change-Id: I80e95eeff84d9a1a28ee3507db82ae33d2ebb937

subject: [ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-04 15:49:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.reports/commit/426c59a06b6da59e06454a542056f994495e0a64', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in Ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

commit_message:
Add tests for cassandra/retry_policy.py

Story: 2007280
Task: 38724

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/679076/

Change-Id: I440e36ad37dc94ffcd665f3925b7f25b5964cbf8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-persister refs/changes/74/652974/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (C) Copyright 2017 SUSE LLC # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslotest import base from mock import Mock from monasca_persister.repositories.cassandra.retry_policy import MonascaRetryPolicy class TestMonascaRetryPolicy(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestMonascaRetryPolicy, self).setUp() self.monasca_retry_policy = MonascaRetryPolicy(0, 0, 0) def tearDown(self): super(TestMonascaRetryPolicy, self).tearDown() def test_on_read_timeout_returns_rethrow_and_none(self): self.monasca_retry_policy.read_attempts = 0 rethrow, none = self.monasca_retry_policy.on_read_timeout(Mock(), Mock(), Mock(), 0, 0, 1) self.assertEqual(rethrow, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETHROW) self.assertEqual(none, None) def test_on_read_timeout_returns_retry_and_consistency(self): consistency = 'some_value' received_responses = 1 required_reponses = 0 data_retrieved = None retry_num = 0 self.monasca_retry_policy.read_attempts = 1 returned_retry, returned_consistency = self.monasca_retry_policy. \ on_read_timeout(Mock(), consistency, required_reponses, received_responses, data_retrieved, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_retry, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETRY) self.assertEqual(consistency, returned_consistency) def test_on_read_timeout_return_rethrow_and_none_if_conditions_fail(self): consistency = 'some_value' received_responses = 1 required_reponses = 0 data_retrieved = ['some'] retry_num = 0 self.monasca_retry_policy.read_attempts = 1 returned_rethrow, returned_none = self.monasca_retry_policy. \ on_read_timeout(Mock(), consistency, required_reponses, received_responses, data_retrieved, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_rethrow, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETHROW) self.assertEqual(None, returned_none) def test_on_write_timeout_returns_rethrow_and_none(self): retry_num = 1 self.monasca_retry_policy.write_attempts = 0 returned_rethrow, returned_none = self.monasca_retry_policy. \ on_write_timeout(Mock(), Mock(), Mock(), 0, 0, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_rethrow, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETHROW) self.assertEqual(None, returned_none) def test_on_write_timeout_returns_retry_and_consistency(self): retry_num = 0 consistency = 0 self.monasca_retry_policy.write_attempts = 1 returned_retry, returned_consistency = self.monasca_retry_policy. \ on_write_timeout(Mock(), consistency, Mock(), 0, 0, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_retry, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETRY) self.assertEqual(returned_consistency, consistency) def test_on_unavailable_returns_tuple_with_retry_next_host(self): consistency = 0 retry_num = 0 self.monasca_retry_policy.unavailable_attempts = 1 (returned_retry_next_host, returned_consistency) = \ self.monasca_retry_policy.on_unavailable(Mock(), consistency, 0, 0, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_consistency, consistency) self.assertEqual(returned_retry_next_host, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETRY_NEXT_HOST) def test_on_unavailable_returns_tuple_with_rethrow_and_none(self): consistency = 0 retry_num = 1 self.monasca_retry_policy.unavailable_attempts = 1 (returned_rethrow, returned_none) = \ self.monasca_retry_policy.on_unavailable(Mock(), consistency, 0, 0, retry_num) self.assertEqual(returned_none, None) self.assertEqual(returned_rethrow, self.monasca_retry_policy.RETHROW)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in Ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I340a7909c49e7d2a8c82c668cbdaf9ced7196f67
Sem-Ver: api-break

commit_message:
Support required for callables

This allows you to to set the required for Fields that use
a callable to select the matching key.

Change-Id: I67136e44b1026c0f997a939b4c7c4abcf20fc09b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/20/701220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if callable(name): raise exceptions.MissingAttributeError( attribute="selected via a callable", resource=resource.path )

- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

commit_message:
Upgrade virtualenv in pre

Since virtualenv 20.0 (amongst other changes) six version >1.12.0 is required.
This change adds upgrade of virtualenv and six in pre - to be reverted once
infra CentOS images are sorted out.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707377
Change-Id: I75249055989309d0afdfc29c894beb6b1fcd1994

Upgrade virtualenv in pre

Since virtualenv 20.0 (amongst other changes) six version >1.12.0 is required.
This change adds upgrade of virtualenv and six in pre - to be reverted once
infra CentOS images are sorted out.

subject: Fix list zones updated at same time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 14:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['designatedashboard/static/designatedashboard/resources/os-designate-zone/os-designate-zone.module.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard/commit/0ca56f97e6e2bab0d9f363f730d1d02dd7f288c9', 'message': 'Fix list zones updated at same time

commit_message:
Fix list zones updated at same time

In case multiple zones have the same update timestamp (updated_at) the
UI did not show any zone and a JS console listed an error
"Error: [ngRepeat:dupes] Duplicates in a repeater are not allowed."
To fix it addTimestampIds needs to get the correct parameter order,
i.e. pass the name of the ID column before the timestamp column name.

Closes-Bug: 1734601

Change-Id: Ib91f873e8f21b71a71b1684317db276b72ae8014
(cherry picked from commit c6d53e4f8a36046c55e08272bf3859d5cb4c7c44)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard refs/changes/18/698918/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Update explicit python3 version requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-04 14:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt', '.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/7c8e05760ab2f02a9defeb145c47dfcfaf73c97f', 'message': "Update explicit python3 version requirement

Since tox.ini explicitily makes reference to python3.6
command, all CI jobs derived from 'tempest-full-py3'
could potentially fail if default 'python3-devel'
package reffers to another python version than the 3.6

For example this DevStack Fedora job is failing:
 - https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/job/devstack-platform-fedora-latest

To fix this problem let reference to python36-devel package
in bindep.txt and let explicitily tell DevStack jobs
derived from 'tempest-full-py3 job' to use python3.6
command instead of python3 (so that required packages
are installed using it).

Despite the fact tempest and openstack services could
perfectly work using different python3 versions, this change is
fixing it to python3.6 should help semplifying technical depts
involved with maintaning CI jobs.

Change-Id: I8d3d7aebd469d1caa432b71a86cba6aeaf11ebc6
"}]
commit_message:
Update explicit python3 version requirement

Since tox.ini explicitily makes reference to python3.6
command, all CI jobs derived from 'tempest-full-py3'
could potentially fail if default 'python3-devel'
package reffers to another python version than the 3.6

For example this DevStack Fedora job is failing:
 - https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/job/devstack-platform-fedora-latest

To fix this problem let reference to python36-devel package
in bindep.txt and let explicitily tell DevStack jobs
derived from 'tempest-full-py3 job' to use python3.6
command instead of python3 (so that required packages
are installed using it).

Despite the fact tempest and openstack services could
perfectly work using different python3 versions, this change is
fixing it to python3.6 should help semplifying technical depts
involved with maintaning CI jobs.

Change-Id: I8d3d7aebd469d1caa432b71a86cba6aeaf11ebc6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/01/705701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support container custom configs for ffwd upgrades

Add ContainerCustomConfig to contain custom config_ids filtered from
DockerConfig.

Those will be matched by config_id != tripleo_stepX and generated into
container_custom_config.yaml. After that the ultimate custom configs
ready for a free use with tripleo_container_manage will be stored at
/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-custom-config/*.json that is not
managed with automatic docker_config deployment hooks. Those are for
a free use, for example in external or genereic deployment tasks.

Change-Id: I14f5862405ffac4181634d8870f4a2513afecafd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/79/707179/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support container custom configs for ffwd upgrades

Add ContainerCustomConfig to contain custom config_ids filtered from
DockerConfig.

Those will be matched by config_id != tripleo_stepX and generated into
container_custom_config.yaml. After that the ultimate custom configs
ready for a free use with tripleo_container_manage will be stored at
/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-custom-config/*.json that is not
managed with automatic docker_config deployment hooks. Those are for
a free use, for example in external or genereic deployment tasks.

Change-Id: I14f5862405ffac4181634d8870f4a2513afecafd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8d48476f35fd3fb05d109aa467811d18da15a15b)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in Ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I99e49c84779439317a9f13307c7e7d2fc092d7fb
Sem-Ver: api-break

commit_message:
Remove coreos-image-builder references

We are taking down coreos-image-builder since it
was never really used, and left abandoned.

More information on this can be found at:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707181/

Change-Id: Idb42353f86f192cc8ff2defbbae71e7df76702c6
